text.wiki:
BGI, currently known as the BGI Group, formerly known as the Beijing Genomics Institute, is a Chinese genome sequencing company, headquartered in Shenzhen, Guangdong, China.It was formed in 1999 to participate in the Human Genome Project as a genetics research center. It also sequences genomes of other animals, plants and microorganisms.BGI Group announced at the AGBT conference in February 2020 that it will make genome sequencing cheaper, breaking the $100 barrier for the first time. The Shenzhen company says the low cost will be possible with an "extreme" DNA sequencing system it plans to offer that is capable of decoding the genomes of 100,000 people a year.
The company has morphed from a research institute that decoded the DNA of pandas and rice plants into a company active in animal cloning, health testing, and contract research.


== History ==
Wang Jian, Yu Jun, Yang Huanming and Liu Siqi created BGI in September 1999, in Beijing, China as a non-governmental independent research institute in order to participate in the Human Genome Project as China's representative. After the project was completed, funding dried up, after which BGI moved to Hangzhou in exchange for funding from the Hangzhou Municipal Government. In 2002, BGI sequenced the rice genome, which was a cover story in the journal Science. In 2003 BGI decoded the SARS virus genome and created a kit for detection of the virus. In 2003, BGI Hangzhou and the Zhejiang University founded a new research institute, the James D. Watson Institute of Genome Sciences, Zhejiang University. The Watson Institute was intended to become a major center for research and education in East Asia modeled after the Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory in the US.
In 2007 BGI's headquarters relocated to Shenzhen as "the first citizen-managed, non-profit research institution in China". Yu Jun left BGI at this time purportedly selling his stake to the other 3 founders for a nominal sum. In 2008, BGI-Shenzhen was officially recognized as a non-profit organization by the Shenzhen government. In 2008, BGI published the first human genome of an Asian individual.In 2010 BGI Shenzhen was certified as meeting the requirements of ISO9001:2008 standard for the design and provision of high-throughput sequencing services, The same year BGI bought 128 Illumina HiSeq 2000 gene-sequencing machines, which was backed by US$1.5 billion in "collaborative funds" over the next 10 years from the China Development Bank. By the end of the year, they reportedly had a budget of $30 million. In 2010, BGI Americas was established with its main office in Cambridge, Massachusetts, USA, and BGI Europe was established in Copenhagen, Denmark. By 2018, they were expanded with offices and laboratories in Seattle and San Jose in USA, and London in the UK, as well were founded BGI Asia Pacific with offices in Hong Kong, Kobe (Japan), Bangkok (Thailand), Laos, Singapore, Brisbane (Australia) and many others.In 2011 BGI reported it employed 4,000 scientists and technicians, and had a $192 million in revenue. BGI did the genome sequencing for the deadly 2011 Germany E. coli O104:H4 outbreak in three days and released it under an open license. Since 2012, it has started to commercialize its services, having investments from China Life Insurance Company, Citic's Goldstone Investment, Jack Ma's Yunfeng Capital, and SoftBank China Capital. That year they also launched their own scientific journal, GigaScience, partnering with BioMed Central to publish data-heavy life science papers. In 2013 BGI reported it had relationships with 17 out of the top 20 global pharmaceutical companies, and advertised that it provided commercial science, health, agricultural, and informatics services to global pharmaceutical companies. That year it bought Complete Genomics of Mountain View, California, a major supplier of DNA sequencing technology, for US$118 million. In the same year, the BGI was roughly valued at $820 million.In 2015, they signed a collaboration with the Zhongshan Hospital' Center for Clinical Precision Medicine in Shanghai, opened in May 2015 with a budget of ¥100 million. They are reportedly being involved as a sequencing institution in China's US$9.2-billion research project for medical care which will last for 15 years. In May 2017, was announced formation of West Coast Innovation Center, co-located in Seattle and San Jose, on the first location planned to work on precision medicine and feature collaborations with University of Washington, the Allen Institute for Brain Science, the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, and Washington State University, while on the second's already existing laboratory with 100 employees to develop the next-generation sequencing technologies. In May 2018, was reached an agreement with Mount Sinai Hospital (Toronto), Canada, for first installation of BGISEQ platforms in North America.The BGI Group subsidiary, BGI Genomics, had made initial public offering in July 2017 at Shenzhen Stock Exchange, raising ¥547 million ($80.7 million), with company's first-day valuation set at over $1.15 billion. In 2018, the BGI was reportedly 85.3% owned by Wang Jian, and the group owns 42.4% of its main unit BGI Genomics. The reported market value for BGI Genomics in July 2018 was around $5 billion, as is of another subsidiary, MGI Tech, specialized in developing and manufacturing technology, which IPO of a stake of about 20% for $1 billion is scheduled for 2019 in Hong Kong. In 2019, competitor Illumina, Inc. filed multiple patent infringement lawsuits against BGI.In 2019, it was reported that a BGI subsidiary, Forensic Genomics International, had created a WeChat-enabled database of genetic profiles of people across the country. In July 2020, it was reported that BGI returned a Paycheck Protection Program loan following media scrutiny. The same month, the Bureau of Industry and Security placed two BGI subsidiaries on its "Entity List" for assisting in alleged human rights abuses due to its genetic analysis work in Xinjiang.


== Key achievements ==
First to de novo sequence and assemble mammalian and human genomes with short-read sequencing (so-called "next generation sequencing")
Sequenced the first ancient human's genome
Sequenced the first diploid genome of an Asian individual, as part of the Yan Huang project
Initiated building a sequence map of the human pan-genome, estimated to contain 19-40 million bases not in the human reference genome
The BGI's first project was contributing 1% of the Human Genome Project’s reference genome and was the only institute in the developing world to contribute
Contributed 10% of sequence information for the International HapMap Project
Produced proof-of-principle study for sequencing the microbiome of the human digestive system, an estimated 150 times larger than the human genome
Key sequencing center in the 1000 Genomes Project
First Chinese institution to sequence the Severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) virus, just hours after the first sequencing of the virus by Canadians
Key player in the open source data release and analysis of the 2011 E. coli O104:H4 outbreak
Sequenced 40 domesticated and wild silkworms, identifying 354 genes likely important in domestication.
Sequenced the first giant panda genome, equal in size to the human genome, in less than 8 months. Sequencing revealed that the giant panda, Ailuropoda melanoleuca, has a frameshift mutation in a gene involved in sensing savory flavors, T1R1. The mutation might be the genetic reason why the panda prefers bamboo over meat. However, the panda also lacks genes expected for bamboo digestion, so its microbiome might play a key role in metabolizing its main source of food.
Key player in the Sino-British Chicken Genome Project
As of 2010, plant genomes sequenced include rice, cucumber, soybean, and Sorghum. Animal genomes sequenced include silkworm, honey bee, water flea, lizard, and giant panda. An additional 40 animal and plant species and over 1000 bacteria had also been sequenced.
Nature in 2010 ranked BGI Shenzhen as the 4th among the top 10 institutions in China with all the others being universities and the Chinese Academy of Sciences. The ranking was based on articles in Nature research journals. By 2016, it topped the corporate institutions list in China as well was 13th corporate institution on global scale. In 2017, among the most productive corporate–academic collaborations between 2012 and 2016, the BGI and University of Copenhagen partnership was ranked as 4th.
Between 2001 and 2013, the BGI featured in around 250 papers published in first-class academic journals.
In 2014, the BGI was reported to be producing 500 cloned pigs a year to test new medicines, and roughly 25% of world's genomic data.
In January 2018, BGI Genomics CEO, Yin Ye, stated they sequenced over 10,000 WGS samples, with additional 20,000 being sequenced by their BGISEQ-500 platform, about 70% of animals and plants until now were sequenced by the company and their partners, as well worked on "over 10 million clinical samples, including running 2.8 million noninvasive prenatal tests, 2.6 million human papillomavirus tests, 1.53 million hearing impairment tests, just over half a million newborn screening tests, and around 25,000 rare disease tests".


== Current research projects ==


=== Human genetics ===


==== Human Genome Project ====

An international project launched in 1990 and declared complete in 2003. They joined in 1999 and provided 1% of the workload.


==== International HapMap Project ====

An international project launched in 2002 and declared complete in 2009. They provided 10% of the workload.


==== Yan Huang Project ====
Started in 2007 and named after two Emperors believed to have founded China's dominant ethnic group, BGI planned in this project, to sequence at least 100 Chinese individuals to produce a high-resolution map of Chinese genetic polymorphisms. The first genome data was published in October 2007. An anonymous Chinese billionaire donated $10 million RMB (about US$1.4 million) to the project and his genome was sequenced at the beginning of the project.


==== 1000 Genomes Project ====

An international project launched in 2008 and declared complete in 2015.


==== International Cancer Genome Project ====

An international project launched in 2008.


==== 1000 Rare Disease Project ====
An international projected jointly initiated with Children's Hospital of Philadelphia in 2011. With it were discovered genes and mutations associated with rare diseases, which was reported in more than 20 scientific publications. They also "co-developed a clinical whole exome diagnostic test offered through CHOP pathology since 2012". They again collaborated in 2017 when CHOP's Children's Brain Tumor Tissue Consortium was joined by BGI's China National GeneBank.


==== Intelligence Project ====
A Chinese project focused on the research of the genetic basis of intelligence launched in August 2012. American physicist Stephen Hsu joined as a scientific adviser and was one of the project's leaders. It was done on 2,200 samples mostly from the United States, out of which 1,600 were of individuals who participated in the Study of Mathematically Precocious Youth and reportedly have IQs over 160, collected by American psychologist and geneticist Robert Plomin.


=== Animals and plants ===


==== 1000 Plant Genome Project ====

An international project launched in 2008 and declared complete in 2015. In 2010, BGI has announced it will contribute US$100 million to large-scale sequencing projects of plants and animals.


==== Three Extreme-Environment Animal Genomes Project ====
In 2009 BGI-Shenzhen announced the launch of three genome projects that focus on animals living in extreme environments. The three selected genomes are those of two polar animals: the polar bear and emperor penguin, and one altiplano animal: the Tibetan antelope.


==== International Big Cats Genome Project ====
In 2010, BGI, Beijing University, Heilongjiang Manchurian tiger forestry zoo, Kunming Institute of Zoology, San Diego Zoo Institute for Conservation Research in California, and others announced they would sequence the Amur tiger, South China tiger, Bengal tiger, Asiatic lion, African lion, clouded leopard, snow leopard, and other felines. BGI would also sequence the genomes and epigenoms of a liger and tigon. Since the two reciprocal hybrids have different phenotypes, despite being genetically identical, it was expected that the epigenome might reveal the basis of such differences. The project aim was to significantly advance conservation research and was auspiciously announced for the Chinese year of the Tiger. Results were reported in 2013 for the genomes of the Anur tiger, the white Bengal tiger, African lion, white African lion and snow leopard.


==== Symbiont Genome Project ====
A jointly funded project announced on 19 March 2010, BGI announced it would collaborate with Sidney K. Pierce of University of South Florida and Charles Delwiche of the University of Maryland at College Park to sequence the genomes of the sea slug, Elysia chlorotica, and its algal food Vaucheria litorea. The sea slug uses genes from the algae to synthesize chlorophyll, the first interspecies of gene transfer discovered. Sequencing their genomes could elucidate the mechanism of that transfer. This work was eventually completed presenting the genome assembly with a total length of 557 Mb.


==== Earth BioGenome Project ====

An international project initiated with the Smithsonian Institution and other partners in 2018, to sequence DNA of the 1.5 million known eukaryotic species on the planet.


=== Microorganisms ===


==== Ten Thousand Microbial Genomes Project ====
The project was started on 1 August 2009, with the mission to sequence 10,000 microbes within 3 years. It includes sequencing industrial, agricultural, medical microorganism and many others. It is done in collaboration with many institutes, universities and enterprises, including Biotechnology Research Institute of the Chinese Academy of Agricultural Sciences and the Tianjin Institute of Industrial Biotechnology of Chinese Academy of Sciences.


== Bioinformatics technology ==
In 2010, the institute 500-node supercomputer processed 10 terabytes of raw sequencing data every 24 hours from its current 30 or so Genome Analyzers from Illumina. The annual budget for the computer center was US$9 million. In the same year, BGI's computational biologists developed the first successful algorithm, based on graph theory, for aligning billions of 25 to 75-base pair strings produced by next-generation sequencers, specifically Illumina's Genome Analyzer, during de novo sequencing. The algorithm, called SOAPdenovo, can assemble a genome in two days and has been used to assemble an array of plant and animal genomes.SOAPdenovo is part of "Short Oligonucleotide Analysis Package" (SOAP), a suite of tools developed by BGI for de novo assembly of human-sized genomes, alignment, SNP detection, resequencing, indel finding, and structural variation analysis. Built for the Illumina sequencers' short reads, SOAPdenovo has been used to assemble multiple human genomes (identifying an eight kilobase insertion not detected by mapping to the human reference genome) and animals, like the giant panda.Up until 2015, BGI had released BGISEQ-100, based on Thermo Fisher Scientific's Ion Torrent device, and BGISEQ-1000, based on similar technology by Complete Genomics, for both of which received an approval from the CFDA for a NIFTY (Non-invasive Fetal Trisomy Test) prenatal test. In October 2015, BGI launched BGISEQ-500, a larger desktop sequencing system, which received an approved registration as a medical device a year later by the CFDA. It reportedly received more than 500 orders for the system and run over 112,000 tests until late 2016. The China National GeneBank, opened by BGI and Chinese Government in September 2016, has 150 instruments of the system. The BGISEQ-500 was developed as a sequencing platform capable of competing with Illumina's platforms with its quality and reduced price. In November 2016, BGI launched BGISEQ-50, a miniature version of desktop sequencer. In 2017, BGI began offering WGS for $600. In October 2017, MGI Tech, a subsidiary of BGI, launched two new sequencers MGISEQ-2000 and MGISEQ-200 (later renamed as DNBSEQ-G400 and DNBSEQ-G50), while a year later DNBSEQ-T7.

text.wiki:
Mai Po Marshes (Chinese: 米埔濕地; Hong Kong Hakka: Mi3bu4 Sip5ti4) is a nature reserve located in San Tin near Yuen Long in Hong Kong.  It is part of Deep Bay, an internationally significant wetland that is actually a shallow estuary, at the mouths of Sham Chun River, Shan Pui River (Yuen Long Creek) and Tin Shui Wai Nullah. Inner Deep Bay is listed as a Ramsar site under Ramsar Convention in 1995, and supports globally important numbers of wetland birds, which chiefly arrive in winter and during spring and autumn migrations. The education center and natural conservation area is 380 acres (1.5 km2) wide and its surrounding wetland has an area of 1500 acres (6 km2). It provides a conservation area for mammals, reptiles, insects, and over 350 species of birds.
The reserve is managed by the World Wide Fund for Nature Hong Kong since 1983 and WWF runs professionally guided visits for the public and schools to the reserve ; the Agriculture, Fisheries and Conservation Department has responsibilities for the Ramsar site as a whole. Deep Bay faces threats, including pollution, and rising mudflat levels that perhaps arise from intense urbanization, especially (in recent years) on the north, Shenzhen side of the bay.
In recent years, it housed over 55,000 migrating birds, including Saunders's gull (Chroicocephalus saundersi) and a quarter of the world's black-faced spoonbill (Platalea minor) population. It also has inter-tidal mangroves along with 24 traditionally operated shrimp ponds (called Gei Wai locally) to provide food for the birds. Mai Po Marshes receives some 32,000 visitors annually. This April 2020 a pair of spoonbill sandpiper have been spotted at the reserve. 
While the area was taken out of the Frontier Closed Area on 15 February 2012, Mai Po Nature Reserve remains a restricted area under the Wild Animals Protection Ordinance (Chapter 170) in order to minimize disturbance to wildlife. 
Visitors need a 'Mai Po Marshes Entry Permit' to enter the Reserve. 
By joining a WWF professionally guided activity you can book online wwf.org.hk/en and be part of a small group ecovisit and WWF will take care of permits for you.  ( From 16 March - small eco groups of 4 will ensure community health precautions to maintain safe , healthy access on your visit with WWF to the Reserve )   
As an individual you can apply for a permit by writing to the Agriculture, Fisheries & Conservation Department of Hong Kong Government. These Individual Permits normally take about four weeks to be processed.
The marshes are also have rich insect biodiversity, being the place the endemic Mai Po bent winged firefly (Pteroptyx maipo Ballantyne) was discovered. Not only was  the species new to science, but it was also the first time for the genus Pteroptyx has been recorded in China. To understand the seasonal population changes, distribution and habitat requirements of the species, WWF Hong Kong have been carrying out firefly surveys of the nature reserve. The surveys have also incorporated Citizen Science participation, and using this approach to further monitor the biodiversity, WWF have incorporated iNaturalist and the City Nature Challenge into activities at their Mai Po centre.


== Avian flu outbreak ==
In February 2008, the Hong Kong government closed Mai Po for 21 days following the discovery of a great egret infected with H5N1, also known as avian flu.  The closing marked the fourth in as many years and was consistent with the government's policy of closing Mai Po whenever an infection is discovered within a 3 kilometer radius of the premises.  The World Wide Fund for Nature criticized the government, however, for what it called a discrepancy between the standards for closing Mai Po and the comparably less strict standards applied in urban areas.  The World Wide Fund for Nature wanted compensation of 1 million Hong Kong dollars. WWF then claimed that the government had not compensated it for lost income.

In Leung, Ping Sun; Engle, Carole R. (eds.). Shrimp Culture: Economics, Market, and Trade. John Wiley & Sons. pp. 167–186. ISBN 9780470276563.

text.wiki:
Splendid China Folk Village (Chinese: 锦绣中华民俗村, pinyin: Jǐnxiù Zhōnghuá Mínsú Cūn) is a theme park including two areas (Splendid China Miniature Park & China Folk Culture Village) located in Shenzhen, Guangdong province, People's Republic of China.  The park's theme reflects the history, culture, art, ancient architecture, customs and habits of various nationalities. It is one of the world's largest scenery parks in the amount of scenarios reproduced. The park is developed and managed by the major travel and tourist corporation, China Travel Service.


== Location ==

Splendid China is situated by the Shenzhen Bay in a tourist area of Overseas Chinese Town (OCT) in the Shenzhen Special Economic Zone. It is a 35-40 minute train ride from Luohu Station on Line 1 of the Shenzhen Metro or 30 minutes by bus (bus number 101 or mini-bus 23 are two examples).


== Hours and tickets ==


== About the park ==
Over 100 major tourist attractions have been miniaturized and laid out according to the map of China. Most attractions have been reduced on a scale of 1:15. It is divided into Scenic Spot Area and Comprehensive Service Area. The entire park covers 30 hectares.
There are cars and trains to transport visitors around the park, making it possible to visit the Great Wall of China, Forbidden City, Temple of Heaven, Summer Palace, Three Gorges Dam, Potala Palace and the Terracotta Army in one day.
The park also hosts several shows depicting various events in Chinese History (e.g. a horse riding show depicting a battle led by Genghis Khan), Chinese Cultural Show, etc. Some of the shows are only performed on weekends.


== Other information ==
Asteroid 3088 Jinxiuzhonghua was named after the park. Chinese Folk Culture Village is adjacent to the park in Shenzhen.


== See also ==
List of parks in Shenzhen


== References ==
Travel China Guide article


== External links ==

Official website Splendid China

very good park , as they made replica of all the historic structure across the world . must visit place. also fire work also good.
China park is green and just what you would expect from a China Park. Little and large ornaments with man made lakes to sit by and rest

On a business trip to Southern China, we were taken by our hosts on a tour of this amazing park. It really is wonderful and provides a fantastic overview of Chinese culture and history. If you're on a short trip to Shenzen, this is well worth checking out

We spent several hours here and I was pretty bored. Its kind of like the Polynesian Cultural Center on Oahu but not as polished and the people didn't speak much or any English so you couldn't talk to the people from the different villages. It was pretty empty when we were

I lived in Shenzhen for several years. During that time I took visitors to many of the attractions in the city. This time I took my daughter to Spendid China. Most of our time was spent on the 'miniatures' side of the park before attending the costume show complete with

We visited here as a group and hired buggies to get around. I would recommend the buggies if you struggle walking as there is a lot of walking to do (the hire is not that cheap). The grounds are well maintained and as promised it had lots of miniatures such as the Great Wall.

The heat and heavy crowds over New Years break week were just too much for me, so I decided not to go in the village on the day I got there. I did, however, enjoy people watching around the beautiful entrance to the park and took pictures. There is a monorail and overpass at
It's really good place for you to understand and traveling the whole china within 1 day. it's a miniature of China. but they put it good presentation.

Attached to Spendid China, the combination of China Folk Culture Village and Splendid China is a wonderful experience for locals and visitors. You will get a comprehensive view and experience of what the different areas and historical periods have looked like at the Culture

Spendid China is a beautiful park with what seems like miles of paths. It is connected to the China Folk Culture Village so I recommend spending a full day between the 2 park. Splendid China is a history lesson like nowhere else with history lessons / information for all the

If you love to explore different cultures & ethnic of Chinese people, this is the place to go. They have very beautiful different & colourful costumes that you can't help but feel in awe when you watch the show.

The place is rather big and you really need a lot of time to move from one scaled model to another. Besides you can take a ride in their buggy and get off where you want to. Lush greenery. Nice place to while away the time.

Splendid China and China Folk Village are combined, so one ticket gives you access to both. They are a good combination with splendid China being a miniature depiction of the styles of architecture and natural scenery of China. The miniature wall is very good....not so

Visited the place with family for a day and I'm sadly to say the place is quite not deserve the ticket price(180RMB). The whole area is big and had various famous architecture in mini size. However, the statues were not protected well and the whole environment was not maintained

It was very good quality for China! Lots to see and do, and open areas to wander about. There were some great models of places that really are spectacular in China - its a great advert for the country. There were small shows and a cinema show we saw. You have to be on the ball a

It's a huger Park, with many greens and tress with a wonderful design. But the Main Attraction are the different 'villages' from every tribe in China. They offers different shows. With 180 rmb, I think its a little overpriced (Kids 90) under 150 cm free, but still I liked it.
It's a great way of getting to know the Asian culture and traditions. Do not miss, the events they organize on Sundays, such as horse riding and archery demonstrations.

A well done park with many replicas of old Chinese civilizations. There is plenty of items to read in English to understand each exhibit. There is a show with horses during day with many ancient dancing shows as well. Well worth the money of admittance.
you will see a lot of Chinese cultural there, very plural. and there's a magnificent Chinese folk show at 7 pm, don't miss it!

The village is a large open space with so much to offer about the different culture within China. The beautifully made replicas of old houses, bridges, rivers, parks, monasteries etc gives you a better understanding of the country and it's people. Lush green with well preserved

I spent about 7 hours in the park. The ticket price is not really cheap, but the park is amazing! there is an extra fee for internal shuttle that goes over the 2 sections of the park in 25 mins. You can get in and out of the golf car when you want. I used the car 3 times, park

We were given wrong information on which metro station to exit. By the time we got to the park it was about 3 hours to closing. The only show we were able to get to was really interesting and worth going to even if it was all in Mandarin. The park is a little dirty and

This place is amazing, it has mini Tinanmen square and good photo opportunites. We had the street food of China, street vendors were walking around and reminding of the old ways. Local shows and performance were amzing in the open air seating.
Fast service, good managing of schedules concern as well as predicting items of dishes. There are only Chinese food

I saw their evening show for Chinese New Year (Lunar New Year). It was spectacular. Lots of dancers and the costumes and props were magnificent. I loved the story line and I was highly entertained. The amount of dancers and live animals was breath taking! The only disappointment

My husband and I visited Splendid China during the Chinese New Year. The park is divided into two sections. One has life-size replicas of different places around China. The other side has miniatures. There were plenty of shops and shows in between for a small fee but well

The replicas blew me away. The Great Wall and Imperial Palace especially but so much of the replicas were amazing. It just makes me want to come back and see more of China outside of the Golden Triangle. The replicas themselves would have been enough but the ethnic village

We went during the International Women's day and I got my entrance tickets at half price (original price is rmb180 per person). The huge park could be divided into three parts: the mini China sceneries, the cultural experience China street, and the China tribal minorities

This is a great place to teach international elementary students about Chinese culture and the diversity in its population. Some great performance of the different minority groups from all over China. Our student especially enjoyed the performances that were interactive. Easily

Our chinese hosts took us there - it was either that or Window of the World, and apart from the peculiar aspects of some of the miniature models of the clay warriers or Mongolia, it was actually a very nice 4 hours spent. Some of the exhibitions and gardens were nicely done.
A lot of things to see and to learn, a must go! Near the window of the world, which is also a must see. A very satisfying day trip!

This was a seriously under rated venue. By far the high light of my visit to Shenzhen and is a whole day event. Both educational and fun whit so much to do and see all for a mere 180rmb but really worth every penny. Miniature china and amusements to delight all the family.
It´s a park with miniatures, but it is dirty and ruined down. Don´t go to the restrooms, are nasty, the dirtiest I´ve ever been to.

This is an amazing tourist park with replicas of much of different parts and times in China. Much of it is interactive and would appeal to people of all ages. The map was in English too and at each exhibit, an explanation was written and narrated in both Chinese and English. It
Liked the relaxing atmosphere. Weekdays are good, weekends can be crowded. Good food stalls and restaurants. Communications are fine

The Park is filled with many minature replicas of places and and attractions you have on your bucket list. Anghor Wat, Wiffel Tower, Taj Mahal, Imperial Palace in Seoul; Mt. Rushmore, New York City, Washington DC; etc.
I especially liked the shows that this little place has to offer. The noodles of one of the restaurants were also great!

This park is awsome spent your time here watching the shows in every village, the scenary is great, the stages are well done, the artist are amazing. The 3 big stage shows are very professional, the horse show is fun and entertaining, the costume show is beautiful and visually

You pay 180RMB for two parks Splendid China and Folk Villages, the second one worth the price, don't waste you time in Splendid China just go around for 1 hour, it is like a public park with minitures but all the lakes are dry and dirty, some of the minatures are closed and the

about Chinese culture and there are several attractions but charge .. attractions taking place at specific time ... a lot of interesting things that you will find here ... do not forget to empty your camera memory card...you will spent time here about 4-5 hours..

you can learn about china culture in this park...china culture of various tribes presented complete in the form of miniatures ... use sandals or shoes that are comfortable while visiting the park because it is quite broad but do not worry you can hire "bugy" if you don't want
a very nice park in which you can learn a lot from Chinese culture and see miniatures of the most important and popular Chinese monuments

We went to Hong kong and decided to visit Shenzhen as well. we took the train from Lo Wu to Huaqiaocheng Station. A short walk less than 5 minutes takes to reach Spendid China. The admission ticket is RMB 180 per person and I find it quite expensive. I reached the place around

Went here on a day trip to Shenzhen and spent the morning at this attraction, I was sceptical that it would be worth a visit but was won over by the quality of the theme park and the exhibits and demonstrations, allow several hours.
We visited the village at night, so it was almost closing time, but we were impressed with the lighting and the romantic atmosphere. Highly recommended to visit.
One of the best theme parks to visit and do not visit the two shows that take place each evening. The shows were truly mesmerizing and entertaining, not to be missed.

Fantastic gardens and water features with scale miniature models of famous Chinese historical landmarks. There are also life sized traditional homes from different parts of China, a traditional Chinese village, and a stage with a live traditional Chinese play. Nice restaurant is

Its a lot of little models of different places around China, which is interesting to see if you've not gone around China. I prefer this to windows of the world which is the same but landmarks around the world, as you get to see places around China. Best to try and go on a

We enjoyed a day of entertainment, recognizing that, in reality, the PRC's minority populations aren't always happy and dancing. The quality of the presentations of folkloric music, dance and games was highly professional. The portion of the park with the miniatures of the
We had a great time at this place. It's like visiting the whole China in one day! I suggest not to go when raining

interesting model villages to show the diversity of traditional architecture in the villages around China, set in acres of gardens that are pleasant to walk around and spend a few hours relaxing. I was surprised how interesting it actually was, although the usual souvenir shops
Quite crowded and a bit disappointing particularly if you have visited the actual sites around China depicted here in miniature. Pretty unremarkable overall.

This attraction is a really good to way to experience the Chinese vision of its own history. the shows and interactive performances are great fun. The highlight would have to be the dance show, fantastic

This place was the highlight of my visit to Shenzhen. Some people might say it's too commercial replica of the villages in interior China but it is great concept of many things under one roof as it would take huge efforts to traverse China to see the authentic villages. The

It's something diff. You get to see the diff cultures in china. They do live shows. The Chinese are very welcoming and very entertaining people. They know how yo put on a show. So deff make a stop there

This park has reconstructed habitat of many Chinese ethnic minorities, with people in traditional clothing and sometimes dance and music show. It is really good in general to discover the variety of ethnicities in China and very good for children.

first time here and i love the park.. though the weather was hot, its still a remarkable place to see. there are miniature of great wall, dalai lama's house, summer palace, forbidden city and tiannamen square... my most interesting part was Kunming.. it looks so real with the

worth to visit.If you want to know about Chinese culture you just come here and everything is completed. I impressed how they arrange the package show for tourist like me. They really know how to create the attraction very well. Especially in Japanese miniature. I love their
A fabulous theme park bringing China at its great diversity and beauty to one location. Don't miss the spectacular evening show, Vegas style

This was included in our private tour with China Tour Advisors, and an odd stop in our itinerary, but we went along with it anyways. It was way hot and humid even for October, so we opted to go during the late afternoon for a few hours and checked out the Mongolian Horse Show

Shenzhen is a city on the Mainland bordering Hong Kong that is best known for shopping. Best known for shopping of imitation branded products and electronics, it is also a major commercial hub. It also has a popular theme park – Window Of The World, which showcases scaled down

Little has changed from my last visits some 12 years ago. Its an interesting tour through the many Chinese nationalities. I found the evening show really fun but my companion thought it was a bit cheesey. Prices were a lot higher then my last visit, not helped by the currency

I last visited this attraction some 12 years ago. It was average then and to be frank it really hasn't changed very much. But if you are in shenzhen with time to kill then you could drop worse then this. The price in my opinion is rather high
This is an amazing place to understand about the depth of the cultural heritage in China. The people grup displays are highly detailed, and the cusume show was truly amazing. A must see.

Splendid China is aptly named... it is the right adjective used to describe a theme park that offers so much more than one can take in on a day out. The evening show/performance (7.30 pm) by itself would already be worth the price (180 Yuan) one pays to enter Splendid China.
they have different variety of activities and shows in different sctions, but the night show at the main stage is the best one, even local people like very much.
Enter go left and see wonders of China. Beautiful miniatures from cultural buildings and nature found in China
If you have not much to do, it could be a good choice to try Splendid China. It gives you a good idea about Chinese famous spots!

Very good to bring the children here, we can see all of China landmark and ethnic here. If you come here you must see the china folk culture show, the special effect is very good and all the girl dancer is very beautiful. Better if come here we take the train or buggy to go

The whole park is done to show China interesting places. Houses of tribes, mountains, interesting buildings. Take several hours to visit the whole park including some shows. Horseback battle was amazing.

Although I wasn't able to get to all the historic sites during my visit, this park is the next best thing. It contains scaled-down versions of all the different sites in China, and gives you the feeling that you're exploring the whole country in a single afternoon. I was

I went here with my best buddies and we completely enjoyed the trip. It was an eye opener to see many miniature structures and understand the culture. Best part was the dance show .We watched 2 of them and it was great fun ! Especially one of the shows where we were taken inside

If you like to feel the environment of traditional China, this is the right place. You would find everything that traditional Chinese people may build: Traditional houses, traditional handcrafts, traditional dances, and even replica of landmarks; all of them are there at once.

I love to be here when I visited Shenzhen. I saw many Chinese culture attractions from different regions in China. Lovely place and recommended to be visited when you are in Shenzhen. the place is located near from OCT station of MRT or just about 50 meter walk from MRT station.

The Folk Culture Village is now part of the Cultural China Park. It is between Window of the World and Cultural China. It is an interesting walk through if you plan on visiting the other park. Peacocks can be seen walking around the village. It is a secondary attraction that
Splendid China is a combination garden and cultural exhibit. The meandering walkways pass by beautiful beds of plantings and detailed miniatures of famous historical places in China. Relax and enjoy!
Nice experiences... Quite large area... Need some time to cover all up.. Seeing this place will make you learn about many Chinese culture at one place...

I only had a short stay in Shenzhen so needed to get the most that I could out of seeing a snapshot of China. It is a well planned park with a great layout that is easy to explore. Hopefully I'll make it back to China to see all the attractions for real.

You can find almost every wonders / landmarks that China has.. Don't miss out the performance by the ethnic minorities! When the neighboring park like "Windows of the World" can be found in other countries, but such a complete miniatures of Chinese wonders, only can be found
a place to see all china culture and miniature, the shows not special and boring, this place too crowded, cannot enjoy.

Is really a copy of different parts of China. If you do not have the chance to see other parts of China or at least to visit the Villages from China is a nice place to visit. Nice due to the fact that you can follow different shows and to by different souvenirs. Take in mind to
I don't like this boring place, will not go there again!!! The entrance fee was RMB150/person. It's not worth for that.
I like all the show in splendid china, the horses show, the china tribe show and the night show like the butterfly dancing show. it was beautiful and great show. great dresses and dance.

We visited Splendid China in the afternoon, but for the limited time, we could only visit the China Folk Culture Show and had no time to visit Miniature China. This culture show is really amazing. The performers were really professional with their beautiful costumes. This

We have visited at around 5 clock in the afternoon and took a mini bus with a tour guide. The place is interesting as it pictures great sightseeings of China. The most enjoyable part of our tour was a live show about Chinese culture: acrobats, clowns, horses and a lot of
Its a good place to spend a day. A lot to see. The splendid china is not that great but folk culture village is a really nice place as there are nice shows at some of them. Good for a one time visit.

Very easy to reach here, just used metro line and get down at Huaqiaocheng/Overseas Chinese Town (OCT) – exit D. With the admission fee RMB150, I can learn about China cultural and its habits, also enjoy with all the cultural show with additional cost but worth to see. Time for
Very recommended place for tourists and foreigner! The shows and attractions were so appealing! A must go place when you visit Shenzhen!

We were staying Hong Kong and came over for the day to look around. The Culture Village and Splendid China are beside each other and a really fun way to spend a day. While the shows are mainly in Chinese they are still great fun to sit through, especially the horse riding

The top attractions in China all made up in a large park of miniature buildings. There was a group of seven of us ranging in age from 12 to 80 and I think we all enjoyed our day here. As well as a walk around the miniature buildings, we also explored the folk culture park along

This is a great little sightseeing stop, which you can plan on spending 2-4 hours depending on how much you like to stop and read/see everything. For foreigners, it's a good introduction to Chinese history, culture, and the diversity of architecture. For natives, it can also be

The place is big and clean. Interesting miniature replicas of China. Either walk or take a tram around the park. There are shows to watch. we didn't get to watch many shows as our guide wasted time in other things and we had to leave. Drinks and food is expensive in the park.

Really enjoy my visit here. With the admission fee RMB150, I can learn about China cultural and its habits, also enjoy with all the cultural show with additional cost but worth to see. Time for the show : - Horse war show : 11.30 am, 02.00 pm, 04.10 pm. Cost RMB10/person -

Summary: You will need a full day if not more. Place is made up of two sections. Cost was 150 RMB for Adult. 1) First. Small miniature park where everything is small models of all the different areas of China. This is very educational and could take a day in it self. 2) Second.

Tourists to Shenzhen must not miss out the tour of Splendid China Park. Refresh yourselves with all the miniatures of different cultures and historic buildings of China nicely displayed. You may need to spend the whole day if you were to browse through every models on display.

The place is big with many nice attractions, but we were there on a hot and humid day and after 2 hours of walking we felt like "no more". My tip is take some sort of motor vehicle inside. There are few options there and I wish I would have done it from the beginning

You would think experiencing China in a few hours is impossible and right you are, but this was the intention behind Splendid China Park. You can see there miniatures of all famous and important venues in the country spread among beautiful gardens filled with flowers. You can

or if you have a longer stay in the city. Always great with visitors because you get an idea of all the great historic and cultural spots in China. Also lots of great artwork to buy. Kids loved the guy who did the lollypops out of honey. Don't miss the Tibetan show. And just by

I've been here two or three times over the years. By now I've visited most of the places depicted here in miniature, so it's more of a review and refresher. They have electric carts you can rent to go around the big grounds and they are not expensive if two or three people

Spending time to browse through all the miniatures and models built in the Splendid China Folk Village covering about 30 hectares of land required more than 6 hours. However, there are cars and trains to transport tourists around the Village, to visit the Great Wall of China,

It's worth visiting and the place was huge. We watched a lot of performance with beautiful stage costume. Enjoyed cultural show, comedy, drama, dancing and history of China. Unfortunately we did not enjoy the restaurant food & service.
I visited this place when on a student trip to Shenzhen, it was a lovely place full of different things to see.....wonderful!! Definately worth a visit - the show at the end was amazing!

If you only have a few days in Shenzhen and aren't sure the next time you will be in China, go to this place to get a sense of what the sights of the country look and feel like. Of course they are all mini replicas, but they are designed in a way where they inspire you to go to

This theme park is a huge complex presenting all villages and their cultures and traditions from various regions of China. Very relaxing tourist spot. Good place for all age groups. Its a good picnic and educational tourist destination. Excellent for group visit.
Its a huge complex having miniatures of all chinese monuments. The miniatures of temple of heaven, summer palace of Beijing are really great. This place is really unique.
If short of time and wanted to view the all diverse culture of china, then this is the place to be, needs a ticket for entrance

This park surprised me. Compared to alot of attractions in China, this was not bad actually. It's huge with lots and lots of walking. And when you get tired, it's great to chill for some Chinese tea near the eateries. Tip: Each attraction has it's own show. You won't enjoy
This is a better place than Windows of the World as it gives you a closer look into the peoples and cultures of China. Must stay for the 7pm show..you won't regret it.

Good place for family with children. It's a huge park with a lot of miniature of chinese traditional houses, famous landmarks, and traditional show performance. Really enjoy the performances both indoor and outdoor.
Very interesting park. Had simple snacks to eat. They were good. We especially enjoyed the Horse Battle re-enactment.
We enjoyed the beautiful costumes of the different tribes. Impressive showmanship. Worth a visit. Only drawback is the toilets are dirty n the rude n crude behaviour of the locals.
google: The theme park is very educational and is maintained a lot better than Window of the World. Take advantage of the scheduled free shows throughout the day. Restaurant choices are very limited.
What an amazing place, there's so much to see, you could spend a whole day and there would still be many more surprises left to uncover. A must go if you visit Shenzhen!

Very nice cultural theme park.  Very informative, included all China historical locations, and southeast Asia countries.  Will take all day to see everything.  Save time to see the shows.  They have through out the day.

I love this. A definite must visit place for the overseas visitor. Recommend to devote a full complete day to take it all in. 1500hrs Mongolian horseback show. 1700hrs Cultural dance show. And 1900hrs (*not 1930hr as printed on their map) …
A place you must visit in Shenzhen city. Need a full day to visit. Must go inside of Tibet temple.
Fun place! Got to see it at night!!!

Convenient location by metro and bus. Ticket is a bit expensive (220 yuan for day ticket) but worth the price with multiple shows and performances. Highlights are the minitures of famous Chinese architectures.
Very entertaining place to go and sightseeing.
Very good
Deserves 10 stars, truly splendid place

(Translated by Google) Very beautiful architectural miniatures from all over China. Worth a look.

(Original)

text.quote: Botanical garden featuring a lake & 6 themed sections, with rare trees, bonsai & other plant life.
trip: 在公园里可以做很多事情。这是一个很棒的植物园，这里有很棒的步道和小路，还有湖，可以租小船游玩。景点还有一座宝塔和一座寺庙。这是可以消磨一天的好地方。
嫌深圳吃喝逛商场有点腻的话，这里也是值得一去的地方。这植物园园区算很大，很多景区，不过对我们来说只有仙人掌温室比较吸引，其他都属可去可不去。温室里气温会比一般的高，所以尽可避免夏天去以防中暑。另外各大景区距入口处较远，建议一开始乘坐接驳巴士。
周末，邀上三五好友去仙湖游玩，各自带上自己准备的食物，感受闹市中没有的宁静，聊天，发呆，阳光拂面，释放快节奏的生活压力。

仙湖植物园没有直达的地铁需要转公交过去，早上8:00后入园成人15/人有小绿车可以到达园内3元/人，工作日人不是很多，但天气很好，路边的三角梅及杜鹃花争奇斗艳开得很好很漂亮，药园里的很多植物都是在路边不起眼的野草进去看了一圈长见识了，多肉及仙人掌园区不是很大但保护得很好，因蝶谷幽兰区在为花展做准备就没进去看，在里面兜兜转转逛了4小时大致看了一遍才出了园区，园区里面有自动售卖机供应饮料，要记得带上些小零食跟吃的园区内吃的很少。
系千人掌打卡嘅地方，系罗湖过去答的士大几20分钟，大约30人民币就到。最不方便是要用微信实购票，然后要攀山，大约二十分钟，就到有景点的展馆。终于去睇仙人掌馆影了不同的仙人掌，很特别，还去了桃花林走了一转，开心。
很多人去仙人掌的温室拍照，可是能拍的就几个点，人又多，不太值得为了拍照特地去。整个植物园可能还在建设中，除了仙人掌温室就没什么好逛的。下了巴士还要再走15到20分钟的路，不建议太热的时间去。

本人2018年8月22日清早与太太两人到仙湖植物园，在门口没发现植物园的公交车服务，于是询问一个叫林伟的检票员，被告知下个月才会有，于是我问有没有其它坐车上山的方法，没想到此人马上显得极不耐烦，大吼了一声“让开”，我当时就懵了，我缓过神后就问他“你难道不会好好说话，难道不会加个请字”，令我震惊的是他竟然回复道“我不会说请，我就是不会好好说话”，态度极其蛮横，并拒绝让我看到他的工作牌，我觉得我有权利看他的工作牌，他就威胁做动作想打人，我就拍了此人的嘴脸，他说我侵犯他的肖像权。
去開D 飲食, SHOPPING既地方多既話, 可以黎呢度, 因為係欣賞值物, 可以慢慢係公園坐下, 休息, 放空一下大腦, 令自己可以減壓, 大約可以用二小時去玩呢度
可以看的东西很多，森林化石、恐龙化石，弘法寺祈福、仙湖划船、湖边步行，人不多，环境很棒，就是里面吃的不多，要提前规划好路线，看是否需要带点食物。
环境超棒的，各种花草树木。建在梧桐山上的。曲径通幽，山清水秀。园内深处，香火鼎盛，因为弘法寺。很多人都是为了去弘法寺参拜才来的。真的很棒的一个植物园，春天时踏青也是不错的。一般情况下仙湖植物园成人门票20元。

仙湖植物园，建于 1983 年，占地 590 公顷，1988 年 5 月 1 日正式对外开放。 特意在冬天来到、这个位于深圳中央、空气清新、环境优雅、并且红叶泛湖的人间天堂。这里有景区、湖区、弘法寺区、保存 4 千多种植物，真是花一天也走不完、拍摄的题材相当丰富。 门票：成人￥20。 交通：罗湖关口乘的士，约 2x 元。 园内巴士：统一收费￥2，07:00 - 18:00。 地址：广东省深圳市罗湖区莲塘仙湖路 160 号 518004。
仙湖植物园，在梧桐山的不远处。环境非常好~里面有挺多植物。春天来的时候，桃花朵朵开。里面还有个庙，听说挺灵的，香火一直很旺...
以前跟朋友一起来这里走一下看看绿色植物。之前住这里附近是不是跑步也会跑到这里来。门票免费如果想看看绿色植物，呼吸好的空气就来这里
好神奇的植物化石，高耸入云的木化石，要经过上亿年的风化呢！园区很大，六点以前入园门票每人＄20，入园先养＄3买公车票，搭到天上人间，在开始登高望远。建议可以花＄10买观光车票，可是一时上下车，先游览一圈。最值得参观的是化石森林。
由于仙湖植物园在深圳最东边，所以只来过一次，朋友说这是一个很知名，而且里面供奉着五彩斑斓的舍利子，很适合祈福。另外植物园环境也很美，适合周末来玩。
该植物园有很多植物奇特，并且种类非常的多，被分成了好几个不同的区域，很有观赏性。此外，在这里也可以是一个休闲娱乐的地方，这里有很多草坪可以在草坪上玩耍嬉戏。
天啊，奉劝大家大年初一不要去仙湖凑热闹了，人山人海，全是来烧香的人，根本没法拜，只能随人流走，下山来，等公交的人流也会吓死人。
公司每年二月初一都会组织所有职员过来深圳仙湖公司，以许下这一年的愿望．里面有个宏法寺，有心则灵，带着你的城意会得到上天的眷顾的．周边环境优美，每年都有很多人过去．
这个植物园很大,里面种植了很多树木,绿树成荫,夏天的时候是一个非常好的避暑圣地.因为绿树多,所以空气非常的好,称得上是大自然超级氧吧.闲时可以在里面散步,或者早上的时候过来跑步都是非常不错的,尤其是早上八点之前进去是不收门票的.还可以租上一辆自行车慢慢骑.感觉说不出的舒服.
景色优美宜人，空气清新，很适合爬山健行走走。植物园内的植物种类相当多元，园内规划相当细心，每个区域都有专人照顾。不过要记得带防蚊液、防晒用品、太阳眼镜、水和口粮。相机也可拍下当天的旅游美景唷。
环境很好，门票价格也不算贵，里面植物很多，也有湖景可看，每天下午6点后免费开放，在里面散步、跑步、骑车也是不错的选择。
很大的一个植物园，园内有著名的弘法寺，很多人都是冲着这个去的。还有很多奇妙的不同的植物，也有细分为苏铁园、热带植物园等，很有特色的是几个沙漠植物馆，有全球各地的仙人掌和仙人球。仙湖不是很大，但是可以带帐篷在那露营，看着他们在帐篷里休息，还是有些羡慕的。
这里的植物生长的很茂盛，一点都看不出是有人为的痕迹，好多植物如果不看介绍都不知道是什么名字，感觉看着绿色植物心情特别好，很不想离开。
喜欢里面的空气，太自然的感觉，不过有点偏坐公交车要好久，刚好是周未有很多的游人，里面园很大，要走完也要半天以上了，不过我们只选了几个大景点观看，沙漠植物区、百果园、、桃花园、水生植物园、盆景园、还有挺多的很多植物观看，还有个叫什么弘法寺的，好多人到这里烧香拜佛，香火很旺，是个很不错的一个园湖景区
里面的空气很清新，环境那可以说算是NO1啦，里没一点农药味道都没有，也不知道是打药的时候不开放还是怎么的，人去别的也是植物园，好大的药味，这里做得不错，赞哦 ·1
弘法寺和植物园都算是比较多人去的点，植物园里花卉植物在国内的点中算是比较多的，可以亚热带植物还是占主导，唯一缺点就是有很多花蚊子，去的朋友请注意防蚊，特别是穿短裤和0型血的朋友，一旦被叮咬可以会起大包，切勿用手去抓；当然里面的植物最好眼光手误动。
记得当时车走不动，尽量不要选假日去。本来很好的地方，人一多，就没有什么太好的心情啦。烧香是一定要的，求福赐子的朋友们一定要哟。记得要带吃的喝的，里面的贵不说，也不好吃。我们是带馒头和咸菜，再带些爱吃的零食，最好的享受啦。
仙湖植物园门票20元，有些贵，应该免费才对，毕竟这是公共绿地。但是的风景的确不错，好多游客过来其实都是为了去宏法市烧香拜佛，以求好运。听说这里的菩萨很灵的。我也去拜了一下，希望佛主保佑家人都平平安安的。
初秋的首个双休日，与小杨一起来过这里。 因为我俩都在丘陵地区长大，这种小山对我们来说毫不为奇。 与所有的植物园一样，这里也是园中园的模式，许多个小展馆散落其间。 总之很不错，惬意的周末。
是中午到的那里。 前一天刚下过雨很多地方都湿漉漉的。但是仙湖公园人气很足。 还有弘法寺，据说是很灵验的寺庙。香火也很旺。很多虔诚的信徒结伴去拜拜。 虽然是为了去看桃花，我们到桃花园的时候，已经是接近傍晚了。有些花已经要凋谢了。不过有一株很美的白色桃花在小山顶上，很多人去拍照~
让人感觉很轻松，很宁静的一个地方。远离尘嚣，置身其中，整个人都得到一种祥和洗涤。但节假日人较多，平时有时间的话去最好好。
深圳仙湖植物园环境超好啊，有很大的户外活动草坪和湖，深圳最大的弘法寺也在里面且香火很旺，还可以爬山，那座山是深圳最高的地方。
仙湖植物园挺不错的，一进园，满眼碧绿，回归大自然，感觉很舒服，里面有一个弘法寺，方丈大师有一百多岁了，看上去很慈祥，是一个很不错的休息之地。
在深圳这样喧闹的城市，仙湖安静的伫立在一隅，当然逢初一十五，各种佛家主要日子是不能去的，仙湖里的弘法寺的香火太好了，周五的下午和朋友一起到那块，在小平树下休憩，看着日光从树荫中透过，旁边是波光粼粼的仙湖，就生出浮生偷得半日闲的感觉来，繁忙的都市 ，这里的确是一个休养生息的好去处
和姐姐一起去的，那天还下着小雨，感觉好好，我和姐姐没有打伞，感受着雨，期待下一次的到来，深圳植物园的感觉好像让我回到了家乡
环境还是很不错的，周末和节假日人非常多，尤其是最好不要初一十五去，开车的话会非常的堵，大家去的时候建议采用大众交通工具
有很多植物,以前认识的,和不认识的,都可以在这里看到,增长了对植物的了解, 但因为游客太多,保护措施跟不上,对植物造成了一定的伤害..
仙湖植物园的弘法寺是深圳本地最热的佛法圣地，我去的时候正是3月初桃花盛开的季节，为的是踏青而去。里面景点密集，有山有水有湖，有亭台楼阁，小桥流水，各种植被及草药，室内花圃，蝴蝶谷，还有化石森林....因为远离闹市，那里显得特别安静，连那一块的天空也比别处蓝。郊游踏青的好去处，各种有趣，很值得推荐！
很美，适合健身，游玩，休闲，人气很旺，一个环境非常好的景点。没事可以爬爬山，听听鸟叫声，钓钓鱼（要钱的，具体多少不太清楚）。要是心情不好，可以去感受一下花语鸟兽大自然一般的环境。总之，值得推荐。（要门票哦）

美丽的自然风光，别具一格的园林建筑，神秘的植物王国，令人赞不绝口。棕榈区绿草茵茵，椰林葵树分布其间，呈现出一派浓郁的热带风光；荫生植物区内，食虫植物伺机捕食；跳舞兰鲜艳的花朵宛然宫女踩着优美的舞步；化石森林中，玛瑙化石傲然挺立，亿年岁月磨灭不了树木的圈圈年轮，仿佛在向人们诉说着地球历史的沧桑巨变；沙漠温室里，沙生植物争奇斗艳；晨曦中，弘法寺钟声回响，诵经曲徐疾有致，令人肃穆；夕阳下，湖水波光潋潋，绿树亭台倒影其中，景色如画，怎不令人留连忘返!
我坐了两个小时的车，到了仙湖植物园，看到一路上吆喝卖甲鱼的，慢慢走进了大深山林里，仿佛走进了仙镜圣地，让我看到眼花缭乱………………
去的时候是9月，游人很少，所以玩得很舒服，不挤不闹，天气还稍微有点热，景色很好，喜欢得不得了，下次再去深圳希望还有机会去一次，去的时候还赶上又在照婚纱照的情侣，真的感觉这里是照婚纱照的好地方，美得很自然，让人恋恋不舍的仙湖植物园！
休闲度假好地方、20元门票。 山青水绿 空气清新自然 很舒服 很享受 可以在大草坪上放风筝 和恋人、和家人、和朋友 感受大自然

到目前为止，这一定是我在深圳见过的最好的地方之一，并且可以轻松地填满一整天。 如果您乘坐公交车很容易找到，我们便乘地铁前往黄碑岭，当您从c出口出来时，就有一排巴士站，然后乘坐220和M 182直达入口。  进入公园需要15年，进入时有巴士将您带到圣殿，另外3年则值得您快速到达那里。 如果您四处逛逛，寺庙很有趣，还有一个人告诉我们那里有免费的食物。跟随一些当地人，我们来到了一个小型的服务舱口，并得到了一双筷子和一碗食物。不知道这是一个特殊事件还是正常事件。食物很好吃，地瓜，山药和一些咸菜和米饭
在炎热的一天，参观了花园。愉快的散步，但不是很多。除非你想要健身，否则寺庙不值得步行。可以看到更好的花园。
我在这里太喜欢了，但到这里的交通不方便，没有太多的公共汽车和没有地铁。我每次去那里都希望我能用每朵花拍照，真漂亮
花园比欧洲的植物园大得多。它实际上是一个公园，在不同的植物展览之间有公交车。虽然有很多游客，但大面积看起来并不拥挤。期待一整天。您可以参观宏发寺。
仙湖植物园也被称为仙女湖植物园，是繁华都市的美丽度假胜地。 这是一个巨大的公园，花几个小时穿过花园，看到一切。 没有餐馆，所以当你记得带午餐或小吃。
如果你和家人一起做好准备。建议使用鞋子，因为要到达植物园，你需要走很少。另一种选择是购买一张可以带你到洪大寺顶部的公交车票。夏天，风景不佳。我在冬天去过，天气寒冷，风景秀丽。对于摄影来说，这是最好的。
一个美丽的花园景点，结合了几个不同类型的花园，都很有品位。愉快的一日游。

在台风Mangkhut之后，我于9月30日星期日访问了这个花园。 虽然这个植物园的地面非常大，但实际上看不到很多东西，尤其是植物和花卉。 部分地区要么封闭，要么仍在建设中。由于台风，还有许多树木和树枝掉落，并且被慢慢清理。 参观整个公园意味着大量的公路巴士上下行走的道路将游客带到公园周围，所以公园实际上不是行人友好的。有些道路没有行人路面。 在花园入口处，您可以选择乘坐公共汽车（3元人民币）到湖边。步行上山需要大约15分钟，沿途看不多。最好的选择是乘坐公共汽车，然后走下去。
这个公园拥有一切。石化树木，仙人掌房间，bonzai花园，池塘，山坡，名单不断。如果你曾经在深圳，绝对值得一试。
优点：   - 很多照片   - 带湖泊的大花园   - 没有人   - 适合与孩子一起散步的家庭   - 到处都是绿地和寺庙 缺点：   - 很热   - 必须走很远的入口   - 单程巴士只到寺庙但不停在其他地方（3元人民币）
我几天前去过这里。这个地方太大了，不要指望在一天之内探索这个地方的所有景点。我走过远足小径。一旦你到达顶部，你可以看到一个惊人的视图。您也可以从这个地方前往最高的山（梧桐山）。这个地方很干净。寺庙是最受欢迎的地方之一，但我没有花太多时间在那里，因为那天人太多了。虽然门票价格便宜，但如果您想乘坐公共汽车上门或返回大门，您必须购买单独的门票。
在大门前买票，每人只需15元，如果你超过60岁就免费。 O操作。然后我建议买3元人民币的车票带你去寺庙。 您可以通过它顶部访问寺庙。 然后走回主入口，如果你有时间参观路上的每个“pavillons”。如果你想要制作所有这些，你需要很多时间。 风景很棒，整个公园维护得很好。 我不会带小孩在那里，因为除了参观之外没什么可做的。

仙女湖植物园是一个位于深圳中心附近的大型公园。我能够乘坐直达那里的382路公交车，然而，由于主要车辆试图进入公园，公共汽车终于让我们在到达那里之前下了几个街区。然而，公共汽车绝对挤满了两个方向，所以如果想到这个困扰你，你可以轻松地乘坐出租车。下车后，有很多人走到公园，所以很容易找到。 15元，进入公园是一笔交易。因为人群众多，如果可能的话，请在工作日去。我进行了一个完美的74度和阳光明媚的星期天，它非常疯狂。如果你一定要去周末，它仍然值得，因为它是一个巨大而多变的公园，如果你想远离人群，去楼梯通向你的任何地方，你可以找到一些隐私！
这是最好的植物园是我去过的。 去那里最好的时间是在冬天，你可以整天都在这里散步而不出汗。 很好的徒步旅行。家庭旅行或者一个人。 更好带上你的午餐和一瓶水
我们非常喜欢这个地方。 就是有几个负面因素这很可能是我们缺乏相关的准备。 当你购买一张票的条目。 还有另一个车票售票处。 不知道价格多少或他们带你到所以我们开始走了。 这个地方很大和我们估计我们走了大约十公里一天的课程。 还有一个很多施工的有限访问权限和降低的设施。 我们推荐的最好的房子和仙人掌的绿色森林。 绝对令人惊叹。 有一个湖附近的咖啡厅供应美味的咖啡,尽管价钱有点贵。

如果你走走,这可能是一整天的时间在一个地方。 几个小时里我在那里的时候我仍然看到了相当多。 我不太清楚其他的景点,不过似乎就足够了,但如果你有时间的话那么我建议你去有限的童话湖泊和森林。 涟源摆放在一个风景如画的山谷和真是很安静的。 还有一个通往所有的湖周围水域,以及它的银行是一个公园一个适合野餐和播放。 对我来说最突出吸引人的地方是森林; 这些树木,像石头一样硬邦邦的标本和史前时代,是惊人。 他们都是建在小公园里有一个锦鲤池塘和它是一个很棒的放松的地方,虽然有一天可能会很吵因为它相邻的越南的人群要来参观这个博物馆。 我的建议是下午晚点去。
这个地方不仅仅是植物园。 在那里你可以看到一些历史的有趣的地方像撕裂和涟源地区。 酒店所在的区域很大而且有很多地方可去和它是很难看到他们一整天的时间。 之间的距离非常长而且地方需要花费一些时间来散散步。 山上的湖周围,你可以找到非常棒的整个公园的景色。
在周末期间,去了这个地方,并没有太多的人。 不错的地方,当地的朋友介绍。 很喜欢这里,并愿意回来再看。

宪祜Botanical Garden是最好的旅游景点,在深圳的现代城市。 这是很大的,和山,所以你应该是一个远足者才能提供的全部优势。 如果你不是和您的唯一目标是佛教寺庙Active Walker, 最明显的,有趣的功能,在公园里,你可以买汽车票,送你到山上尽量避免多走路。 孩子们也会喜欢这个花园,因为有很多东西要在其上的仙女CLIMB和湖泊,租船。 门票20RMB Garden（$3）和孩子（高度来衡量,不是年龄）是10元,因为是老年人60 - 69； 70岁以上免费。 看着一切,您应计划大约6小时,但就是参观寺庙,走仙女湖3小时即可完成。

这是一个很大的公园 - 太大了,一个是有硬性Walker Disabled或游览时间。 如果天气很热很潮湿,因为是在十一月中旬,它将会更加困难。 还是很漂亮的,但是我看到其他的公园,在深圳,甚至更漂亮。 为人民币3可以坐公交,它会带你山上,靠近Temple。 值得！ 这是一个很长的爬上Hill。 本来应该是有一个电动巴士,周围人很多,但是却没MATERIALIZED VIEW Park了。 我租了一个脚踏船。 但是公园太大了,天气太热,我真的公园,你可以就看不到西南（这正是我希望是这样的）。 很容易迷路,因为地图不是很详细。 早点去,以避开人群。
一个很漂亮的花园,但要小心,因为Names Flora只有中文写的。 所以有点混乱！
这是一个美丽的花园,有很多的旅游,和一个小湖泊,一个或两个将带您到湖边。 如果你有大排档,徒步远足Lesser有一些小的纪念馆。 那里有很多的植物和树木Ranch。 有一些台阶,但是,你可以带着这些不同的路线。

text.wiki:
St. Anthony’s Catholic Church (Chinese: 天主教深圳圣安多尼堂) is a Roman Catholic church in Shenzhen, Guangdong, China.


== History ==
The church building covers an area of 3,944.8 square metres (0.9748 acres), and is located along Nonglin Road, Futian District, Shenzhen. The foundation of the church was laid in April 1998, and the church was completed in December 2001. Building the church took three years and eight months. The design of St. Anthony’s Catholic Church aims to symbolize the spirit of Catholicism in the Shenzhen Special Economic Zone. The construction of the church required the efforts of a large number of Catholics.St. Anthony’s Catholic Church is an international parish, which each Sunday at 11:30am provides the Holy Mass in English for Catholics from overseas who live and work in Shenzhen.


== Parish ==
The church has three Sunday Masses (主日弥撒), at 9:00 am on Sunday, and 11:30 am on Sunday (English) and 8:00 pm on Saturday. It also has weekday Masses (平日弥撒)  at 7:30am in the morning from Monday to Saturday.


== Transportation ==
Take subway Line 2 (Shekou Line) to get off at Qiaoxiang Station. Getting out from Exit A and walk 850 m (2,790 ft) to reach the church.


== List of bishops ==


== References ==


== External links ==
(in Chinese) Official website
trip: 深圳圣安多尼教堂位于农林路, 距离地铁站大约3-4分钟左右。 这里是外观挺漂亮的天主教教堂, 在外面拍一下照也很漂亮。
本人并不信教，但是有这么一个地方，没有去过，所以抽空过去以参观的性质前往。地方还是容易找到的，而且建筑风格也很有特色。
这所天主教教堂位于福田区，邻近香蜜湖，门口有巴士站， 交通都算方便。而且论斤深圳市儿童乐园，相信不少家庭可以在星期天作完周日弥撒后便到乐园享受天伦之乐。
我在深圳見過最大的教堂建築，無論外觀的色彩還是建築形狀都令人肅穆具有莊嚴感。教堂外面的院子展板可以看到會有很多活動舉辦，教堂內高聳莊嚴蔚為壯觀。
深圳的圣安多尼天珠教堂造的很宏伟，十分有气势，很新很漂亮很有气派，里面宗教活动的氛围也十分的好，好多虔诚的教徒来这里作礼拜
到那之后就感慨了一句：好大的一个教堂啊！是我去过的最大的教堂了，里面也很气派，摆设建筑都很有基督教的道义，让人不禁的就对这个地方感到肃穆。去的时候刚好赶上他们做礼拜，我也很虔诚的做了祈祷。
这个是我去过最大的教堂了，里面很气派很肃穆，做在里面整个心都宁静下来，看介绍活动也很多，有很多资料供取悦，建筑也非常有特色。
非常热情，离地铁站不远。你不仅可以在周日去那里。真棒
我们去了中国的前几天。这是一个非常活跃的教会。我们感到很受欢迎他们让我们10岁的孩子帮忙拿出礼物。
它很大，对我来说感觉有点刺耳和寒冷，而不是我喜欢教堂的欢迎场所。服务很好，有许多热情的人。它拥有天主教所提供的所有类型的服务，并且一直都是开放式的。
被他们演唱的歌曲感动了。每个人都唱歌。一些歌曲开始于女性部分，其次是男性，并结束了两种声音
一个非常好的经历。下午2点参加了弥撒。这是一个很好的精神弥撒。一本小册子被用来跟随群众，这是一个我从未从世界任何地方得到过的丰富多彩的小册子。
去中国的服务。 非凡的合唱团的男人。 就是很漂亮。 很容易到你可以乘坐出租车或地铁。 还有一个星期天的服务包括在英语2:00 p m的教堂很大也很漂亮。
还有在每天上午 7时30分Mass ,周六和周日两个群众8下午, 9上午 2下午,英语 很棒的地方,很容易坐地铁
